intro: Lasiococca malaccensis, commonly known as the Malacca lasiococca, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly Malaysia and Indonesia, where it thrives in tropical rainforests. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and dark green, glossy leaves. It typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and as a landscape plant.
